DataElement.preferredName: Intraperitoneal Route of Administration Adverse Event Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to any untoward medical occurrence in a patient from the use of a method of delivering fluids and drugs directly into the abdominal cavity through a thin tube.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intraperitoneal Route of Administration Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any untoward medical occurrence in a patient from the use of a method of delivering fluids and drugs directly into the abdominal cavity through a thin tube.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug via injection or infusion of a substance into the peritoneum, where it is absorbed by the lining.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
